articles.title: Hong Kong Imprisons Media Mogul, Intensifying Digital Control
articles.summary: Pro-democracy media mogul Jimmy Lai has been sentenced to 20 years in prison under Hong Kong's national security law. This conviction, stemming from an alleged conspiracy to collude with foreign forces, is seen as a significant blow to the city's press freedom and autonomy under Beijing's influence.

articles.title: Apple Preps iPhone 17e, New iPads and Macs for 2026
articles.summary: Apple is reportedly planning a major product launch in early 2026, featuring the iPhone 17e, new iPads, and Macs. This indicates a strategic refresh across its core product lines, aiming to introduce advanced technologies and maintain market dominance in the competitive tech landscape.

articles.title: Ocado May Cut 1,000 Jobs, Signaling Tech Sector Downturn
articles.summary: Online grocer Ocado is reportedly considering cutting up to 1,000 jobs as part of a major cost-cutting initiative. This move, if confirmed, signals a potential downturn or restructuring within the tech-driven logistics sector, impacting employment and market confidence.

articles.title: Homegrown Startups Outperform, Challenging Tech Talent Norms
articles.summary: A recent study indicates that homegrown startups are outperforming companies founded by 'returnee' tech talent. This challenges the traditional notion that international experience is always superior, highlighting the strength of local ecosystems and potentially shifting investment priorities within the tech industry.

articles.title: San Francisco's Pro-Billionaire March Highlights Inequality
articles.summary: A 'pro-billionaire' march in San Francisco, while small in attendance, draws attention to the city's stark economic inequality. This event underscores the growing tensions between rapid tech-driven wealth accumulation and widespread socio-economic disparities, sparking debate on urban planning and social justice.

articles.title: Roundcube Webmail Vulnerability Allows Email Tracking
articles.summary: A vulnerability in Roundcube Webmail allows tracking of email opens even when image blocking is enabled, exploiting the SVG feImage feature. This security flaw raises significant privacy concerns for users, as it circumvents standard protections designed to prevent read receipts and tracking.

articles.title: Japan's Election Landslide Consolidates Conservative Tech Policy
articles.summary: Sanae Takaichi's conservative party has secured a landslide election victory in Japan, consolidating its power. This strong mandate could reinforce existing industrial policies and potentially influence the nation's stance on technology regulation, digital trade agreements, and R&D funding.

articles.title: GTA Modder Reimagines Classic for Modern PCs, Preserving Gaming History
articles.summary: A dedicated modder has successfully adapted the original 1997 Grand Theft Auto game to run on modern PCs and the Steam Deck.
